snippet: With the state’s legislative session nearing an end, pressure had mounted for weeks in the Democratic-controlled State Capitol to resolve the matter.
abstract: Illinois House of Representatives votes to allow same-sex couples to wed, ending months of delay over issue in Capitol and clearing way for Illinois to become 15th state, along with District of Columbia, to permit gay couples to marry; bill now goes to desk of Gov Pat Quinn, who has said he will sign it.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and STEVEN YACCINO

lead_paragraph: With the state’s legislative session nearing an end, pressure had mounted for weeks in the Democratic-controlled State Capitol to resolve the matter.

headline.main: Illinois Sends Bill Allowing Gay Marriage to Governor
headline.print_headline: Illinois Sends Bill Allowing Gay Marriage To Governor

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
